152.content:
"She seems enthusiastic," Jenna nudged her boyfriend in the arm as they followed their guide through the doors.

"She seems nice," Matt shrugged.

"You were just staring at her boobs," Jenna said with a smirk.

"I was not," Matt said defensively. "They are pretty big though..."

Jenna and Matt had met in college, while he had been study health and fitness, and she had been taking business studies. Matt had made no secret of the fact that his ambition was to one day own and manage a gym in town. Jenna, however, was a little more uncertain as to what her future held. She had often been stereotyped as air headed in high school purely because she was on the cheer squad; but nothing could have been further from the truth, she had studied really hard, and got a first class honours degree in college...she just wasn't really sure what her future held now.

She and Matt had first met when they noticed each other on their morning jog. After two weeks on running past one another, Matt had finally plucked up the courage to ask Jenna out, and she had immediately said yes, having been hoping he would do just that. They had been together ever since, and now lived together, having moved in just after graduating.

They had both been surprised to get the invite to the grand opening of the factory, and Jenna hadn't even really wanted to come, but Matt had suggested she take a break from planning her future career to have some fun. What exactly was fun about this place, however, she wasn't sure...

As they passed through the doors, they found themselves in a large, open space resembling a huge garden. The room seemed to go on for miles, and she was amazed she had missed it when she first approached the building. Through the room, she noted that there were trees and bushes that seemed to be growing...candy? Candy canes stuck out of the ground, chocolate bars hung off the trees and candy flowers were growing on plants. There were also large, oddly shiny looking fruit growing everywhere; she spotted blueberries, strawberries and pears, just to name a few.
152.title: Jenna and Matt

choices: Go eat some of the candy forest

Go to The Cabinet
1523.content:
"You wanna try some of the candy?" Matt said to his girlfriend. Jenna smiled at the suggestion,her previous talk with the man faded away in her mind. The couple paced over to candy section of the land ignoring the fruits all around them. They gaped at the selection of confectioneries all around them.

"Hey what's that overthere?" Matt questioned. Jenna followed the man as he led them farther into the candy flora.

"What did you see?" Jenna asked.

"It looked like something glowed behind all this stuff. It was like it was metal or something." Matt walked farther inwards and Jenna soon noticed how every plant seemed to grow larger the farther they traveled. The candy though got more exotic in appearance, though not to the point of being alien.White chocolate bars and mint chocolate candy canes were just some of the new sweets that were revealed.

"Matt, I don't think we should be here."

"Why would they not cut this area off if they didn't want anyone to see it?" Matt answered. Soon though the duo came to a large clearing, a brief shadow passed by the pairs eyes, but their view was quickly filled by the area in front of them. A large house, which seemed to be made of gingerbread, was built with a small pavilion in front of it. A decorated fountain was the epicenter of this clearing. Tables, though untended,were scattered around randomly. One chair and table was filled however, with a young woman drinking from a teacup.

"Hello?" Jenna hesitantly introduced herself. The woman looked up from her cup and smiled, she placed it onto the table to greet the pair.

"Ah you must be some of the contestants, I'm Alana, pleased to meet you." Alana dusted herself off to give the pair an open handshake. She was dressed in a modest pair of workshorts and a sun-flower shirt;Matt noted her seemingly curveless body compared to Elena,though didn't choose to vocalize that point.

"What's this place?" Jenna said. She sat down onto a chair, while Matt stood looking at the working woman.

"This is The Cabinet,though management has some gobbley-gook name for it. Its where we display our really sweet stuff, things that are not planted in the candy forest." Alana explained.

"So is that where the candy for the factory is made?" Matt asked.

"Oh no, that's down the chocolate river, hopefully you'll see it during the tour. No, here is the place where our perfected goods are displayed." Alana took a sip of her tea. "You can knock on the door if you'd like, Denise will gladly show you what we have in stock at the moment."

"Noted." Jenna spoke. "But why change it out though? Who eats the candy or whatever else you have in there?"

"Us workers and the little gals. Ahh you don't need to worry about the little gals though, they won't bother you on the tour." Alana said nonchalantly. "Oh if you'd like, we can have a small lunch together, I can phone in Elena to tell her where you two are at."

Jenna and Matt shared a look, both pondered on what to do next.

"Let's try The Cabinet, Matt!" Jenna asked excitedly. The man looked over to his girlfriend and nodded in response. Jenna 'squee' in delight as the two made their way from Alana towards The Cabinet. Alana smiled before she took out a walkie-talkie.

"Hey Miss Elena, yeah, two of the targets are making their way towards Denise." Alana spoke. She put away the walkie-talkie and continued to drink her tea.

The gingerbread building would've been quite imposing if it wasn't, you know, made of gingerbread. Was the building actually made of gingerbread though? That didn't make it look structurally sound. But if the duo dwelled on that thought, they'd have question the candy forest that laid behind them.

"Do we knock or?" Jenna asked until the door creaked open. The two jumped up in surprise, only to see a fairly tall woman peak her head out. She wore,of all things, a purple dress stylized to fit the candy themed surroundings. Her earrings were some sort of sweat.

"Welcome you two,I'm glad that two contestants have chosen to grace this humble abode." She stepped aside to allow the two in. The couple hesitantly walked in until the very calming looking interior made their journey inwards much less hair-raising.The smell of frankincense and hazelnut filled the air. Stairs that led to the second floor spiraled upwards. The two gaped in shock.

"Come, lets get to the store," Denise interrupted their gape. The duo nodded and approached what was probably the store section of this building. Glass drawers and stands greeted them, signs were placed on top of the glass that read what candies they held.

"Look around and tell me what you like," Denise said.

153.content:
Sophie was definitely eager to get started. Though the other guests didn't seem that into it, Sophie had been incredibly excited for this tour ever since she received the invite. She had no idea what she had done to prompt the mysterious invitation, but she half hoped, if it wasn't too immodest, that her work had somehow drawn her to the attention of Elena and her company. She had been following the young company exec admiringly for some time, watching her rise to fame and success. They were the same age, and Elena was a role model of sorts.

While Sophie certainly took pride in her work, she had started to feel like her talents were a little wasted at work. Her creativity was stymied and her bosses were quite controlling. They often put down her more esoteric ideas and designs, wanting things that was more traditional and conventional. Sophie was a shy girl, and didn't really have the courage to stand up to them. She had often found herself without much confidence. Even amongst this group, she felt a little invisible next to the glamorous Elena, sexy Megan and athletic Matt and Jenna.

"So, when do we get to see how you make the candy?" Sophie asked excitedly, sidling up to their hostess.

"I like your enthusiasm, Sophie," Elena winked at her with a smile. "But patience, there's plenty to see before we get there. I really enjoyed your cake decorations, such creativity."

Sophie clasped her hands together and gave a happy little squeal. "Oh my god, thank you so much. I had no idea you'd even seen my work but I thought maybe you might have I don't know oh my god..." She rambled on, fangirling enthusiastically.

Elena laughed. "Oh yes, I took the time to get to know all the guests on the tour. I was really very impressed with your cakes. You have a bright future."

Sophie couldn't believe what she was hearing. "Do you think I might be able to work for you one day?"

"Maybe sooner than you think," Elena smiled.

Sophie gave a little squeal again as Elena turned back to address the others, welcoming them to the first part of the tour. As Elena spoke, Sophie's head was filled with ideas about her future, what roles she could work in, what candy she could create, what flavours she could come up with...maybe she would have a job by the end of the tour! And her parents had always said it was a waste of her talents going into this business. Ha!

Sophie walked on ahead, following the other's into the first room. Instead of a factory floor, she found herself treading on very realistic grass. The room seemed to go on for miles, and she was amazed she had missed it when she first approached the building. Through the room, she noted that there were trees and bushes that seemed to be growing...candy? Candy canes stuck out of the ground, chocolate bars hung off the trees and candy flowers were growing on plants.

"This is amazing!" Sophie said out loud, running forward and admiring the garden. She couldn't believe they had created something so fantastic. She had to know more...

Dorothea:

Job: College Student at Spring Falls College

Age: 18

Appearance: Long brown hair, beginnings of an hourglass figure

Preferring to go by Dora rather than Dorothea, Dorothea doesn't work for Expansive Candy. Instead, her father works somewhere within the main factory, though he refuses to say where exactly. After every shift, he returns home with a bag of candy in hand, candy he's more than willing to pass onto his darling daughter.

Dorothea herself studies English at Spring Falls College, and hopes to become a famous author someday. She's a kind person who enjoys being social, however if she gets into a creative mood, she tends to shut herself off from the world until she works it out of her system. Likewise, writer's block can cause her to hide away.

Having jumped from job to job since leaving high school, the role of Cleaner was not one Riley initially envisioned for herself, yet the pay and additional benefit of sneaking candy home with her convinced her to take the job.

An eternally optimistic person, Riley tends to live in her own little world. Not much can lower her mood while in public, however acting so cheerful leaves her exhausted and hungry in the evenings, leading to her putting on a little weight.

1551.content:
"Urgh, not again!"

With an exasperated exhale, Dorothea crumbled up yet another piece of paper and swiped it from her desk, where it joined countless other paper balls, each bearing the exact same opening sentence. With her desk clear, she leaned forward, resting her forehead atop it.

"I've been at this for hours now!" Dorothea sighed, lightly drumming the back of her head. "And I just can't get the wording right! The girl... The girl... The girl focused... No, she thought hard... Argh!"

In one swift motion, she sat up and jumped to her feet, her chair rolling back a few inches. Intertwining her finger behind her head, she strolled around her room, stepping over other failed attempts at writing. This wasn't even her first attempt at beginning her assignment, it was her third!

On her first attempt, she had gotten about a page into her work before deciding it wasn't up to her usual standards, at which point she had torn the page in half and then in half again before dropping it into the trash. Her second attempt hadn't even reached a full page before she destroyed it and now, on her third, she couldn't even get an opening sentence! It was enough to drive her absolutely insane!

"Maybe I need a break! Yeah, that should do it!" Dorothea came to a halt at the foot of her bed. With a deep inhale, she prepared to fall forwards into its soft embrace, to drift off into a sweet, dreamless sleep that would leave her feeling refreshed and ready to try again for the fourth time...

"Dorothea, I'm home!"

Hearing the front door open, followed by the voice of her father, Dorothea halted her fall, pushing herself back onto her feet. With a smile on her face, she raced for her door, prepared to rush downstairs and see her father. As soon as her hand grabbed the doorknob...

"If you're coming down, don't forget to dress properly!"

"U-Uh..." She paused, glancing down at herself. She was indeed dressed, however it wasn't what most people would call 'decent'. While her bottom half was clad in a pair of baggy pyjamas pants, she wore only a bra on her upper body, a bra that was getting rather snug around her ample chest. Grabbing the matching top, she hurriedly threw it on and ran downstairs, a wide smile on her face. "Dad!"

Her father, who was busy rummaging around the kitchen, stopped just in time to get tackled by her. The duo chuckled between themselves for a moment before Dorothea pulled away, smile still on her face. However, it lasted only for a few seconds before vanishing, replaced with a stern expression.

"Dad, you're working way too late!" She chided him, watching as he dug around in the fridge. "I barely see you anymore!"

"Oh, I'm sorry, Dora..." He apologized, pulling a container marked with his name from the fridge. "I promise, I'll make it up to you. Right now, in fact!"

Setting his dinner off to the side, he moved to the table and picked up his bag. Unzipping it, he shifted some stuff inside before producing a transparent bag filled with various small objects. Handing it to Dorothea, she inspected the bag.

"Candy?" She asked, recovering an affirmative nod in response. "Well... I suppose it's something... Thanks, Dad".

Giving him another hug, she watched her father rush around the kitchen, a sad smile on her face. Since starting at that new candy factory, she had been seeing less and less of him, only really seeing him in the evenings or, occasionally, some mornings she managed to get up early.

"I'm off to bed, Dad," Dorothea finally said, inching towards the archway leading to the stairs. "Don't stay up too late!"

"I won't..." Her father chuckled. "Goodnight, Dora".

"Night!"

Returning to her room, she quickly discarded her top and flipped down atop her bed, bag of candy still clutched in her hand. She eyed it for a few moments, curious about its contents. She had heard nothing but good things about the stuff that factory was producing. Normally she didn't like to eat anything sugary before bed, but surely a few candies wouldn't hurt?
1551.title: Dorothea

Curious to see the candies were as good as people said they were, Dorothea sat up. Gripping her goodie bag, she hesitated, recalling the last time she was allowed sugar before bed. She was an adult now, capable of controlling herself!

"Let's see what I've got..." Gently tearing open the bag, she poured its contents into her bed and began to pick through them. "Chocolate balls, gobstoppers, strawberry laces, fizzy cola bottles... An awful lot of variety for just a simple goodie bag! Hmmm..."

Reaching out a hand, Dorothea scooped up...

155111.content:
"These look particularly nice!"

Scooping up a handful of wrapped chocolate balls, Dorothea rolled one between her fingers. It was perfectly smooth, a slight shine to its brown surface. Setting the chocolate balls off to the side, she returned the rest of the candies to their bag and set it atop her nightstand, making a mental note to share them with her class. Not everything in that bag was to her liking, and she wouldn't want to throw out perfectly good candy.

Grabbing one of the chocolate ball, she quickly unwrapped it, eager to taste it. Chocolate was a particular weakness of hers, especially milk chocolate. It was just so rich and creamy... And the way it melted atop her tongue, spreading its divine taste all around her mouth... Oh, how she loved it!

"Down the hatch!"

Dropping the small sphere into her mouth, she allowed it to sit atop her tongue for a moment, softening the sweet treat slightly, before chomping down. The taste of caramel filled her mouth, pulling a delighted moan from her. Swallowing hungrily, she reached for a second one, eager to taste it again. The caramel was so sublimely sugary, the chocolate was so thick and milky...

"Mmm... Sho gud!" Dorothea mumbled as she pressed three caramel ball into her mouth at the same time. She teased one with her tongue, rolling it around her mouth, while she pushed the other two to either side and allowed them to slowly melt. Falling backwards, she allowed her treats to dissolve in her mouth, eventually releasing their sugary innards. "Ohhhh..."

Swallowing, her eyes gradually fluttered shut, the sugar apparently having no affect on her...

=====


"More!"

Dorothea slammed a fist down on the arm of her chair. The room around her shook and, seemingly from nowhere, small brown spheres rained down around her. With excited hands, she began to grab as many of them as she could, ramming them hungrily into her mouth.

"More... More..."

These were the only words she could utter as she devoured more and more of the heavenly chocolate rain. With each handful, her hunger for more grew, her thoughts turned to the caramel balls...

"Gimme more!"

A giant ball landed in her lap, easily the size of her own head. Yet its size did nothing to deter her as she picked it up and dug in, quickly demolishing a hole in the outer chocolate layer to reveal the amber insides. Lifting it to her lips, she hungrily chugged the thick liquid, ignoring the bloating sensation in her midriff...

=====

*RIIINNNGGG*

Dorothea sat bolt upright as an alarm rang through her room. Glancing towards her alarm, her eyes went wide as she saw the time.

"Half eight... I need to get ready!"

Jumping out of bed, she began to rush around her room. Pulling her pyjama bottoms off, she replaced them with a pair of denim jeans. Pulling on a black shirt and her favourite red leather jacket, she ran for the door, pausing partway to scoop up her bag. As she passed her mirror, she paused again, noticing something off with her reflection...
155111.title: Caramel Chocolate Balls

choices: As class progresses, Dorothea's thoughts begin to turn to the chocolate balls...

1551112.content:
"What the heck?" Dorothea raised an eyebrow as she caught something off with her skin. She had rather fair skin, not so light that people would think she spent all her time hiding from the Sun's rays, but not so dark that they'd think she spent every hour of every day bathing directly in them either. But rather than her pale, almost ivory, skin meeting her gaze, slightly tanned skin greeted her. "W-What? Why am I..."

Stepping closer to her reflection, Dorothea inspected herself. It was a noticeable enough change in hue, one that, upon further inspection, wasn't restricted to her face. A quick glance down her top revealed that her torso had also changed colour, looking more brown than white. Her hands, her legs, even her feet had all changed!

"People don't just tan overnight!" She said, scratching her arm just in case it rubbed off, which it didn't. "And it doesn't even look like a tan! More like I've been this colour my whole life..."

Staring at herself for another minute, Dorothea eventually shook herself from her thoughts. While the change was concerning, it wasn't affecting her in any discernible way. And she was running late...

I'll check it later! For now, I need to get to class!

And with that, she ran from her room.

=====


Just in time!

Dropping into her usual seat at the back of the room, Dorothea pulled her books from her bag and prepared for the lesson. After yesterday's failed attempts at beginning her assignment, she was looking forwards to this distraction. Her professor was a witty guy, always throwing around puns and metaphors that, once in a blue moon, broke her from her block. She just hoped that today was one of those days.

Standing behind his desk, he looked out over the room, receiving a few chuckles in response. The lights in his class had been broken for almost a week now, leading to no end of light based puns.

15511122.content:
"So what was Mark Twain trying to convey to us, the readers, in this particular paragraph?"

Dorothea glanced down at the paragraph in question, quickly scanning it a couple of times. Usually, she was rather good at picking out the keywords and working out what they meant, but today... She just wasn't feeling it. With each reading, the words blurred closer and closer together until the page was one big black mess.

What is up with me today? Dorothea wondered, flipping back a page only to find it was just as blurry. I'm just... so tired...

A long yawn escaped her mouth as she sank into her seat. The benches the College provided for students were uncomfortable at best, receiving no end of complaints from people nursing numb backsides, but in her unexplainably exhausted state, the wood felt just right for a quick nap.

Just... Just a few minutes... I shouldn't miss out on anything big...

With another yawn, she leaned forwards, folding her arms atop the desk to form a makeshift pillow. Resting her head atop them, she did her best to focus on whatever Doctor Griffin was teaching but, before she knew it, her eyes had closed...

=====


"Dad!"

A bright smile adorned Dorothea's face as her father strode into the kitchen. He clutched his usual brown briefcase in his left hand while the right held a large bag of familiar brown balls. Her smile only widened when she caught sight of the delectable treats.

"More candies!"

Her father smiled before disappearing in a puff of smoke, the bag falling to the ground and spilling its contents everywhere. Dorothea fell to her knees, extending her arms and gesturing for the candies to roll towards her. They all obeyed, changing directions and heading straight for her. Upon reaching her, they began to neatly stack atop one, forming layer upon layer until a pyramid consisting of caramel chocolate balls had appeared in front of her.

"Oh, so many chocolates..." Dorothea inched towards the pyramid, the tip of the structure level with the top of her head. Reaching a hand up, she carefully plucked the top chocolate away, slowly unwrapping it and dropping the ball into her mouth. "I forgot how good these tasted... I need more!"

Throwing caution to the wind, Dorothea began to ferry chocolate after chocolate to her mouth. With each one she swallowed, her hunger only grew, demanding she eat more. She was all too happy to obey, now grabbing handfuls of the balls. She was barely even chewing anymore, intent on eating as much as she could.

"That's it, fill me up! Fill me full of your sweet caramel!"

Dorothea moaned as the words left her mouth. She felt so incredibly full, yet she just couldn't stop herself from eating. As she reached the last layer of the once glorious pyramid, she fell forwards, landing comfortably atop something soft. Glancing down at herself, she caught sight of her rounding body. Her perfectly spherical belly, stuffed full of chocolate and caramel. Her thickening ass, each cheek round and hefty, rising high into the air...

"W-Wait, what's happened to me?!" The sight of her body broke her from her ravenous state, worry washing over her. Moving her hands down to her belly, she began to rub it, only to find doing so caused her skin to rapidly darken. With a scream, she yanked her arms away and tried to stand, however her legs refused to obey her. Her arms reached out, resuming their frantic feeding. "Mmph! No more..."

Her body refused to obey, stuffing her with more and more candy. Ann's with each one, she swelled larger and larger, her body becoming increasingly spherical...

=====

"N-No!"

Dorothea awoke with a jolt, startling the people sitting on either side of her. Ignoring their startled gazes, she sat up and rubbed her eyes, somewhat disoriented after her nap.

"I... I'm still me..." Dorothea sighed in relief as she gripped her flat belly. "God, what a weird dream... No more candy before bed for me..."

Rubbing her eyes again, Dorothea returned her attention to the front of the room, only for Doctor Griffin to conclude the lesson.

"I'll see everybody in a couple of days!" He announced to the room. "Remember, we'll be moving onto a new author next lesson, so make sure to decide which one you want me to cover! Goodbye for now!"

The room began to pack up, all aside from Dorothea who was still trying to understand her weird dream...

Practically skipping to her next class, Dorothea was the very picture of cheerfulness. Sure, her day had started off weird, what with her skin suddenly changing colours, but now it felt like absolutely nothing else could go wrong!

"Hopefully this feeling translates over to my writings later!" Dorothea hummed to herself as she rounded a corner, the classroom door coming into view. "And I hope this next class doesn't... Hmm?"

Coming to a stop, the joyful girl fished her phone from her pocket. Glancing down at the screen, a familiar number greeted her, one she didn't hear from all that often. When she did hear from it, however, it was usually something pretty bad.

"Well, that's my day ruined..." Dorothea grumbled before answering, lifting the phone to her ear. "Hello?"

"Hello. Am I speaking to Ms Dorothea Browne?" A bored masculine voice answered her.

"Of course you are, Christopher, do you really need to ask every single time you ring me?" Dorothea asked with a sigh.

"Just need to verify your identity, Ms Browne", Christopher answered. "It wouldn't do for me to talk with some stranger, after all".

I'd rather be talking with some stranger. They'd be more interesting than you, Dorothea thought with a smirk. "Whatever. I presume you've got a reason for calling me?"

"Of course I do. You think I enjoy our little chats?" Christopher answered with a haughty chuckle. "I'm phoning to inform you that your father will be out of town on business for a few days. He would have phoned you himself, but he has been rather busy of late".

"Great..." Dorothea's heart sank. She barely saw her father as it was, and now he was out of town? This day was turning into a rollercoaster of emotions. "Anything else?"

"Yes. It appears he arranged a daily delivery of our Caramel Chocolates to be delivered to your home. It needs to be signed for, so do try to be home. Otherwise, I have to deliver it myself and, honestly, I have better things to do with my time than act as your personal postman," Christopher chuckled again, the noise causing Dorothea to sneer.

"Isn't that what you're paid to do?" She shot back.

"I'm paid to be your father's secretary, not yours. Now, I believe that is all, so I bid you good day".

And with that, Christopher hung up. Dorothea stared down at her phone for a moment, still processing the news. She knew her father was somewhat important within the new factory that had just opened up, but that was all she knew about his job. She didn't know the title, the pay, who he worked with...

"At least he saw fit to let me know, even if it was through that git," Dorothea grumbled, pocketing her phone. "Anyway, happy thoughts, happy thoughts... Back to class!"

And with that, she started towards her class...

"I've completed a chapter!" Dorothea let out a joyous yell, a grin spreading across her face as she saved her work. "Well, almost completed. But I can fix those little mistakes some other time. Now, I think a few chocolates are in order... Huh..."

Putting the box back together with considerably more care than she opened it with, she shut her laptop down, making sure she had actually saved her work before doing so, and got to her feet. "Urgh... Who would've guessed eating an entire box of chocolates would leave you feeling so bloated?"

Clutching her belly with both hands, she discovered that it had developed a slight curve to it, presumably due to her snacking. Wandering towards her mirror, she paused in front of it, turning to the side to get a better look at her midriff.

Still not used to seeing me with a tan, Dorothea eyed her skin for a moment before shifting her gaze down to her belly. Yeah, looks like bloating. Should be gone by the morning! If not, well... I can always walk it off!

Before leaving her mirror, she gave her belly a couple of slaps. Doing so, however, forced a chocolatey burp out of her, each one louder than the last. After unleashing a belch that would've made her own father simultaneously proud and somewhat concerned, she wisely decided to stop.

With her work done, the rest of Dorothea's evening was rather dull. After cleaning up some of the rubbish strewn around her room, she returned to her computer and began to look for a replacement for her bra, only to give up ten minutes later.

I dunno, this one just feels right... She thought to herself, staring at a rather lacy vibrant red bra. I'll give it another couple of months...

After her failed attempt at shopping, she found herself staring at Google, unsure if what she could do. She could always try more writing, but she didn't want to burn herself out this early. It was still rather early, so bed wasn't really an option.

"Let's just search something random..." Hitting a random key on her keyboard, which turned out to be 'E', a whole host of various results greeted her. "Ebay, Etsy, Expansive Candy... Actually, I wonder what shows up if I search for them?"

Clicking on Expansive Candy, a bright website greeted her. 'Expansive Candy' was printed across the top of the screen, each letter resembling a piece of candy. There was a section showing some employees, the company mandate, a product section... The usual website stuff.

"Wonder how much these chocolate balls cost?" Dorothea navigated to her new favourite snack, her eyebrow rising as she spotted their cost. "Wow, that much? Guess what Dad said is true, I do have expensive taste when it comes to snacks!"

Chuckling to herself, she shut down her laptop. With nothing else to do, she made her way downstairs, made herself something simple for dinner, made sure the front door was locked, and then retreated to her room. Grabbing her Kindle, she jumped into bed, ready to knock out a few chapters of the book she had bought recently. However, barely give minutes in, and an odd exhaustion washed over her.

"Alright... Guess that's me for the day..." Dorothea dropped her Kindle on her nightstand and, one hand resting atop her belly, slowly drifted off to sleep...

“UMmgh.”
